DIGEST OF  HB 1112 (Updated February 4, 2025 12:10 pm - DI 1 41)
Citations Affected:  IC 27-1.
Synopsis:  Prior authorization for opioid use disorder care. Provides
that a utilization review entity may not impose prior authorization
requirements on medication for opioid use disorder. 
Effective:  July 1, 2025.
King,  Bascom
January 8, 2025, read first time and referred to Commi ttee on Insurance.
February 4, 2025, amended, reported — Do Pass. Referred to Committee on Ways and
Means pursuant to Rule 126.3.

HOUSE BILL No. 1112
A BILL FOR AN ACT to amend the Indiana Code concerning
insurance.
Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Indiana:
1 SECTION 1. IC 27-1-37.5-5.5 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
2 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
3 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 5.5. (a) As used in this chapter,
4 "medication for opioid use disorder" means medication that:
5 (1) was approved by the federal Food and Drug
6 Administration not later than January 1, 2025; and
7 (2) is prescribed for the approved purpose of treating opioid
8 use disorder.
9 (b) This section expires July 1, 2027.
10 SECTION 2. IC 27-1-37.5-8.3 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
11 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
12 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 8.3. (a) As used in this chapter,
13 "utilization review entity" means an individual or entity that
14 performs prior authorization for one (1) or more of the following:
15 (1) An employer who employs a covered individual.
16 (2) A health plan.
17 (3) A preferred provider organization.

1 (4) Any other individual or entity that:
2 (A) provides;
3 (B) offers to provide; or

5 hospital, outpatient, medical, prescription drug, or other
6 health benefits to a covered individual.
7 (b) This section expires July 1, 2027.
8 SECTION 3. IC 27-1-37.5-18.2 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
9 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
10 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 18.2. (a) A utilization review
11 entity may not impose prior authorization requirements on
12 medication for opioid use disorder.
13 (b) This section expires July 1, 2027.

COMMITTEE REPORT
Mr. Speaker: Your Committee on Insurance, to which was referred
House Bill 1112, has had the same under consideration and begs leave
to report the same back to the House with the recommendation that said
bill be amended as follows:
Page 1, line 3, after "Sec. 5.5." insert "(a)".
Page 1, delete lines 4 through 11 and insert ""medication for
opioid use disorder" means medication that:
(1) was approved by the federal Food and Drug
Administration not later than January 1, 2025; and
(2) is prescribed for the approved purpose of treating opioid
use disorder.
(b) This section expires July 1, 2027.".
Page 1, line 14, after "Sec. 8.3." insert "(a)".
Page 2, between lines 8 and 9, begin a new paragraph and insert:
"(b) This section expires July 1, 2027.".
Page 2, line 11, after "Sec. 18.2." insert "(a)".
Page 2, line 13, delete "or treatment".
Page 2, after line 13, begin a new paragraph and insert:
"(b) This section expires July 1, 2027.".
and when so amended that said bill do pass.
(Reference is to HB 1112 as introduced.)
